title: How to Reset a Netgear Router: Complete Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Locate the "Reset" button.
steps.content: Locate the "Reset" button. It's on the back of the router and may be labeled "Reset" or "Restore Factory Settings." [1] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 24 June 2021. [2] X Research source The button is small and recessed to avoid accidental resets.

steps.title: Insert a bent paper clip into the recess.
steps.content: Insert a bent paper clip into the recess. [3] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 24 June 2021.

steps.title: Gently press and hold the button for about 15-20 seconds.
steps.content: Gently press and hold the button for about 15-20 seconds. The power light will begin to blink. [4] X Expert Source Stan Kats Cybersecurity Expert Expert Interview. 24 June 2021.

steps.title: Release the "Reset" button.
steps.content: Release the "Reset" button. The router will reboot and the power light will glow a solid green or white. The Netgear router will be restored to its factory settings. Follow the instructions in the documentation for your model to set up and configure your router .

steps.title: Locate the buttons on the side of the router labeled "Wireless" and "WPS."
steps.content: Locate the buttons on the side of the router labeled "Wireless" and "WPS." [5] X Research source

steps.title: Press and hold the "Wireless" and "WPS" buttons simultaneously for 6 seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the "Wireless" and "WPS" buttons simultaneously for 6 seconds. The power LED will blink red.

steps.title: Release the buttons.
steps.content: Release the buttons. The router will reboot and the power LED will be solid. The Netgear router will be restored to its factory settings. Follow the instructions in the documentation for your model to set up and configure your router .
